definition: to root out/to eradicate/to sweep away/to abolish
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: They weeded the mounds and piled fresh dirt atop.
sentences.chinese: 他们铲除坟上的杂草，再将在坟顶堆上新鲜的土。

sentences.english: Though thou shouldst bray a fool in the mortar, as when a pestle striketh upon sodden barley, his folly would not be taken from him.
sentences.chinese: 你尽可在臼中将愚人舂碎，但他的昏愚却永不能铲除。

sentences.english: The razing of slums has added to the number of homeless, and dozens have died from exposure to the cold, literally freezing to death.
sentences.chinese: 对贫民窟的铲除也增加了无家可归者的人数。

sentences.english: The vice-adviser advised the reviser to devise a device forgetting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代办参谋倡议校正者想出一个铲除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: In the sphere of theory, destroy the roots of ultra-democracy.
sentences.chinese: 从理论上铲除极端民主化的根苗。

sentences.english: They did away with more than 20 local despots that year.
sentences.chinese: 那一年他们铲除了20多个恶霸。

sentences.english: And tanaka has been dried tangerine or orange peel to remove, changsha temporary calm for a period of time.
sentences.chinese: 而田中也被陈皮铲除了，长沙暂时平静了一段时间。

sentences.english: By eliminating this ticking time-bomb, the possibility of serious accidents had been ruled out.
sentences.chinese: 铲除了一颗定时炸弹，避免了灾难性事故的发生。

sentences.english: "Father, do you think Patrick should be eliminated?" Estelle asked.
sentences.chinese: “父亲，你也认为帕特里克应该铲除？”埃斯特尔问。

sentences.english: Workers rake up globs of oil, which have come ashore on the beaches.
sentences.chinese: 工人以犁耙铲除已漂到海滩上岸的油水珠。

sentences.english: Abstact: Human society has entered into era that it wants to eradicate any colonist system thoroughly since 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 世纪以来，人类社会进入了彻底铲除殖民制度的时代。

sentences.english: Shortly thereafter, the Separatists arrived, determined to wipe out the Lurmen village.
sentences.chinese: 不久以后，分裂势力抵达马里登，决定铲除勒明人。
但它们必须要被铲除么？

sentences.english: The vice-mechanic suggested the reviser to devise a computer device forgetting rid of vice.
sentences.chinese: 代理照拂建议校订者想出一个铲除恶习的计谋。

sentences.english: Thus Yan Ying was able to remove three potential threats to the country of Qi without lifting a finger.
sentences.chinese: 于是晏婴不费吹灰之力就铲除了齐国的三个隐患。

sentences.english: It is a great failure that China did not erased Lamaism in Tibet.
sentences.chinese: 中国一直未能铲除喇嘛教是一大败笔。

definition: to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to flatten/to level/to raze to the ground
to put an end to/to annihilate/to cause to perish/to perish/annihilation (in quantum field theory)
to sweep/to clean with a brush/to sweep away (often fig.)
remaining evil element/surviving members (of evil former regime)/dregs (of colonial administration)
